intro: Turraea adjanohounii, commonly known as the African turraea, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
